Posts.Content: Jacqueline Rotherham a bit far for me to commute, I am up in sunny Aberdeen. I think I will accept my BCN is very busy. The nurses in the Anchor Unit, which is the chemo ward are lovely, and Friends of Anchor provide lots of lovely treats (nail painting, free fruit, painting by numbers etc) so probably can't complain. Mo
Posts.Title: BCN

Posts.Content: Hi Jives68 I am not too bothered, but I did think she would have been in touch after my first chemo to see how I was. Oh well I  might hear from her as she said she was going to book me on the look good, feel good course. But if I don't I may just drop her an email to ask if she is booking it or if I have to do it myself. I do always say that there are people worse off than me. I find I get more support from this site, as you get info from people who have or are going through the same thing. Mo xx
Posts.Title: BCN

Posts.Content: Just out of interest is a BCN meant to do, apart from seeing her twice while in for initial appointments and a couple of calls to book scans I have never heard from her again. Is this normal as I didn't really know what her role was. Mo
Posts.Title: BCN

Posts.Content: Avril I don't actually need to see the doctor,I just need more of my injection, but as I am not up to delivering my letter from the hospital I will probably have to go and make an appointment to get it. My mum might try and get it for me, but my step dad was taken in to hospital this morning, not sure what is wrong with him, just waiting to hear. We have a very small family, I could give the letter to a friend to drop off, but I need to know if I will get my prescription and when, or if I can get it sent to my chemist. Feel like I don't need this stress at the moment. Mo
Posts.Title: docetaxel has floored me

Posts.Content: Thanks Pat I have been thinking of your mum and dad. I am hoping that my step dad is ok, still waiting to hear, they take so long to process them at the hospital. I may just phone my doctors and explain my predicament, although mum said if they keep my step dad in overnight she will go to my doctors on the way to the hospital tomorrow. I may even feel better tomorrow, as this is the longest I have been out of bed in the last 2 days so it is promising.  My friend sent me a pic of the dishy guy from our work to cheer me up. Wonder if he would mop my brow?
Posts.Title: docetaxel has floored me

Posts.Content: Thanks guys, My FEC was ok, felt like I got off lightly with it. I have just gone to bed when I feel tired, and get up for a couple of hours. It is not so much lack of taste that has got me it is loss of appetite. I am still eating a little bit, but not very much, but I am drinking plenty water.  I have to do daily injections for blood clots as well, so I am hoping I am better soon as I need to hand in a letter to the doctors and get a repeatprescription, so I can get more of my injection as only have enough till next Friday, and doctors appointments are like gold dust.
Posts.Title: docetaxel has floored me

Posts.Content: Just found out my step dad has had a brain haemorrhage, I feel so useless that I can't be with my mum. I know my step sister is there with her hubby. I just phoned my brother-in-law and he said he will pop in past the hospital after work. Step dad is in theatre, but they do say it looks positive. Of course they tell you the worst just in case.  This now puts my problems in perspective, I am going to put on my big girls pants tomorrow and go to the surgery with my prescription, and not leave till I know my prescription is going to my chemist.
Posts.Title: docetaxel has floored me

Posts.Content: Well my oncologist was right, my first docetaxel is a killer. Was ok first 2 days after chemo, but have been in my bed for the most of the last 2 days. Haven't had much of an appetite either. I am hoping I will start to feel a bit better tomorrow, don't think I can stand another day like this. Mo x
Posts.Title: docetaxel has floored me

Posts.Content: Gina I was diagnosed just before Xmas and had to stay positive over the festive period to not upset my Nephew and Niece as they lost their mum to pancreatic cancer. Mine hadn't spread to my lymph nodes and I started Chemotherapy at the end of January, the only thing that worried me was losing my hair. I stayed positive all the way through as they say on tv more people survive cancer than die from it. I have since had my lumpectomy which after chemo the tumour was greatly reduced. I should have the results of the biopsy in a couple of weeks, but I feel confident that they got it all out. I think my next step is radiotherapy, but after chemo I feel I can handle anything. Just stay strong and just follow the consultant/doctors advice. Just remember to listen to your body and if it says take it easy do so. Oh I also told all my friends as soon as I could as I wanted them to treat me no differently from normal. I was determined it wasn't going to beat me, so I didn't let it get me down. This is a brilliant site and the people on here are lovely and as they are either going through the same as you or have they are the best to talk to. Don't be afraid to ask anything, no matter how stupid it may sound. Mo
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday Ali I hope you are celebrating in style. Mo Xxxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Well done Susie. I am with Pat I was struggling to walk round house last week after 1st Tax. You give us hope for the future.  Mo xx
Posts.Title: A big step today

Posts.Content: Well done Pat, it feels great doesn't it Are you sure the mammogram is a routine one as I had to go for a mammogram and ultrasound yesterday so they could get the results before surgery. Take it easy now, rest up and get over this bout, just think no more after this.  I just want to get my life back now, just want to have some energy and to be able to eat what I want. You need to snuggle up with MD Big hugs Mo xxx
Posts.Title: DONE IT !!!

Posts.Content: These stories give me hope that there is light at the end of the tunnel. Mo Xx
Posts.Title: One year on........

Posts.Content: Good luck Caroline and Ali for you final chemo, hope it is nice to you.  Mo xx
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: Pat I went to my LGFG session last night it was really good. I went to my local Maggie's Centre which is lovely anyway There were 9 people there and nearly as many people there to help us. We were each given a goody bag based on our skin colouring. I was the only person there who was currently undergoing treatment, some of them had their treatment years ago which surprised me. In the goody back there was make-up remover, cleanser, toner, moisturiser, colour corrector, foundation, concealer,eyeshadow,eyeliner, eyebrow pencil, mascara, 2 lipsticks, lip balm lip liner, face powder, blushed, a brush for putting on eyeshadow and a 50ml bottle of perfume. All from various counters in Boots.  We had a good laugh putting on the makeup, they would demonstrate on someone how to do it then we got a go.  The other plus side of the night was one of the girls who was helping used to work with me and I haven't seen her for years so we had a bit of a catch up. Went for my bloods today and the ontology nurse said I might be a bit aneamic, so she took an extra thing of blood to check, so might not get chemo on Friday. As I have been really tired and breathless this week. But I also have had high colour and stretching a lot, so she said that could be an allergy and has put me on anti histamines to see if that helps. She said she will phone me tomorrow. How have you coped with the reduced dose this time? Mo xx
Posts.Title: Look Good Feel Good

Posts.Content: Pat Shame you have to go to Hull for your session, but it will be worth it.  Good news that your mum has seen sense, it will be a weight of your mind knowing they are getting help and their meals delivered. That is not good that the reduced dose hasn't made a difference. I haven't suffered from aching joints at all, might be all my natural padding, lol. I was feeling ok till this week. I have been told I am not anaemia so getting my chemo as normal tomorrow. Will be glad to see the back of it, hopefully will start to pick after it. That will be nice to get some time away, hopefully you will get good weather. Good idea to stay in a guest house as I find if you stay with friends or family you are tempted to help them do things at least in a guest house you will be waived on and can walk away and leave the washing up to someone else. I could go and stay with my friend in Inverness but she likes her drink too much and don't think I could cope. Mum is too busy for me to stay there. So just hope we get good weather here so I can just go and sit in the sun, getting sick of the rain now. Mo Xx
Posts.Title: Look Good Feel Good

Posts.Content: Hi Pat We are lucky haven't had thethunderstorms, mind you I do like to watch them. Sorry but it made me laugh that your tortoise ate your petunias. Now don't go killing yourself doing gardening, I don't have much of a garden, probably a good thing as I don't know a flower from a weed. Mo xx P.S. my hormones must be all over the shop today as I am sitting crying at the Soap Awards, haha
Posts.Title: Look Good Feel Good

Posts.Content: Welcome. I am having my second chemo tomorrow, I was so anxious about my first one I was sick before I left the house. I really didn't know what to expect. I ended up sitting next to a lady who was on her forth and her positive attitude made me feel better. We had a laugh and a good chat, her daughter was with hot her and my mum with me. Time passed quite quickly. I have been feeling relatively ok for the 3 weeks apart from being a bit weary.  Hope everything goes ok Big hug for tomorrow. Mo xx
Posts.Title: going for my chemo chat today

Posts.Content: I think I over did it today. Day 5 after first FEC, I got up and had my shower, breakfast etc, then put 2 wheelie bins out. I then had the dentist for fillings, but felt really tired. Then I took the bus into town to do an earned, but had to go and sit in my building society as I felt really lightheaded and a bit sick. When I felt better I went and bought a sandwich and ate it with some water. I had an appointment with podiatrist after that, but they made me sit a while to make sure I was ok and phoned a taxi for me.  Came home and had something to eat and felt fine.o Did I just overdo it, or was it because I needed something to eat, should I have phoned the helpline. I feel fine now and have checked my temperature and it is fine. Mo
Posts.Title: Over dit it today.

Posts.Content: Thanks Jane I have an appointment to see about getting my wig tomorrow, but I might postpone it if I don't feel up to it tomorrow My problem is I live alone and am fiercely independent, I just need to space out my things to do a bit more. My problem was I have been feeling fine up till today, so I think I got too confident. Mo
Posts.Title: Over dit it today.

Posts.Content: I did wonder if the funny turn was down to low blood sugar though, I must make sure I eat at the right times or carry something with me.
Posts.Title: Over dit it today.

Posts.Content: Hi Pat, sorry to hear about your mum. If your dad has a good sense of humour he will be fine in a home as he will get other folk to chat to. You definitely need to finish your chemo, no matter how hard it is. Your mum is in the right place, and your dad is putting your health before his as any parent will do. He knows it won't be that bad, and he knows he will get looked after. I know it is hard but you need to put yourself first as your mum and dad would be upset if anything happened to you, as you are still their baby. Sending you a mega big hug Mo xx
Posts.Title: Good news and bad.!!

Posts.Content: Hi, I get my first tax next Friday, after having come through 3 fec fairly ok. Had the consultant yesterday and he said the 4th one is the worst, I am now scared at what is going to hit me. As I haven't been that bad I agreed to go out for lunch with my friend a week after my chemo, now I am worried I will let her down. I wish it was all over. Mind you on the plus side consultant said my tumour had shrunk considerably. Sorry I haven't been of any reassurance  Mo
Posts.Title: Hit a brick wall

Posts.Content: I woke up this morning full of the cold. I know when I was going through chemo I would have had to go to the hospital for them to check me out. I am now over 2 months post chemo and have had my lumpectomy, do I need to still let them know if I am ill? Or do I just have to cope with it myself like a big girl?  Mo xx
Posts.Title: Got a cold

Posts.Content: Pat I find I have a very sweet tooth just now. Enjoy your walk, I am heading to a friends for tea as she is making me macaroni and cheese with garlic bread, can't wait. Mo xx
Posts.Title: sore mouth.

Posts.Content: Hi Pat, At our chemo unit they hand you a recipe for salty mouthwash to be used morning and night, I occasionally add a bit of bicarb to it as well as that helps. I must admit I find I have had a sore mouth now and again, I read that pineapple helps as well. I have found it quite good for a dry mouth. I bought biotene gel for my dry mouth. I use a soft toothbrush on my electric toothbrush. I know my tastes have changed a bit as just fancied a peanut butter sandwich, took a mouthful and can't eat the rest, yuck! Mo xx
Posts.Title: sore mouth.

Posts.Content: I went out for lunch with a friend and I am just home. I had hot smoked salmon, radish and rocket, followed by coley goujons and hand cut chips, followed by creamy rice pudding with a rhubarb sauce. Had my first real drink out as well, shared a bottle of Merlot followed by a cocktail. I did space it out with water as well. Felt good to go out as hadn't been out since I started my chemo. Mo xx
Posts.Title: What a difference

Posts.Content: As you know from my previous post I start my Chemotherapy on Friday. So I started on Monday by burning my hand with hot soup so ended up in A&E. Tuesday I had my pre chemotherapy chat and did bloods, but they seemed ok about burnt hand. Wednesday I was back up at hospital to get Coil marker fitted and to get a bone scan. While in getting coil marker fitted the staff nurse grilled me about my burn and it turned out she used to be a burns nurse. She wasn't happy about my dressing and sent me back to A&E to get it redressed to her instructions. So I was at the hospital for nearly the whole day. And now to top it all my period started today. If I wasn't a strong person I would probably cry, but do want to scream, aargh!!!!
Posts.Title: Chaotic week

Posts.Content: Pat, I am going to ask when I see my nurse tomorrow if I can get mine reduced as well, have really struggled the past 2 weeks. I have barely left the house as I don't have any energy. As for housework well that is a different story.  At least we only have 2 more to go Pat that is the plus side.
Posts.Title: Tax reduction

Posts.Content: Pat, my step dad has been moved to his lo c all hospital as they have a stroke unit, but he is doing well. He has been up walking, and mum said h e poured water with his weak hand yesterday and didn't spill. His speech is slow but clear. So hopefully he will be home soon. How is your mum? Did she stay in hospital? I am going to ask, because I am tired just having a shower, never mind doing anything worthwhile.  I will let you know how I get on tomorrow. If they say no I might cause a scene, lol My niece is coming home from uni on 10th May so have something to look forward to.
Posts.Title: Tax reduction

Posts.Content: I didn't have to wait to long to get mine, and it is handy as it is at the local Maggie's Centre at the hospital, so might try to change it. They do day and night appointments.
Posts.Title: Tax reduction

Posts.Content: Hi Pat, my ontology nurse has requested I get my dose reduced. I told her to tell the oncologist that if he doesn't, he will have to come and do my housework. She offered to give me another week before chemo, but I want it over and done with. As long as my bloods are ok I should have my 5th chemo on Friday, and hopefully reduced. It took all my energy to go to the hospital and back today.  I am thinking of cancelling my look good feel good session on Tuesday, as I am worried I won't be up to it.  Mo xx
Posts.Title: Tax reduction

Posts.Content: Maggie I might phone them tomorrow to see if I can change the appointment. I know from my last chemo I couldn't get out of bed never mind go out anywhere.
Posts.Title: Tax reduction

Posts.Content: Hi Pat That is not good, hopefully they will get everything sorted soon. I am fortunate I haven't suffered from the aching joints. I only seem to be bothered with fatigue. But as my mum keeps reminding me no more chemo, so it is onward and upward. I don't have a date for surgery yet, but have an appointment with oncologist on Friday. It has been a sunny day today so far, but last night was wild. Looks like it is going to be really warm at the weekend, will have to watch and not burn my bald head .Mo Xxx
Posts.Title: Hi there ladies.

Posts.Content: You will be fine Pat, just keep taking deep breaths. I am sure everything will go well. Save the brandy for later. I had the follow up from my surgery today and they are happy that they got everything out and my scar is healing well. My breast doesn't feel any different from before. I just have my radiotherapy to go now, I have an appointment in 2 weeks to discuss that. I feel very positive that it has all gone and I am going to be fine.  I will keep everything crossed for you, but I am sure you won't need it. Lots of Love Mo xxx
Posts.Title: Impending op and high BP.

Posts.Content: Caroline I was told by my ontology nurse I could have take away as long as it was from somewhere I had had before and could trust. I must admit not been out much as afraid of infection, but also on the same note I was asked to go to my doctors for a chat to see how my treatment was going today. I was sitting in the waiting room wondering what everyone was there for and would I catch it, started to feel paranoid. One of my friends said she is going to cook a meal so I can have a night out at hers with a couple of friends, to make me feel I am still sociable. Mo Xx
Posts.Title: Good Morning Ali Owl

Posts.Content: I have taken one now as I about to go to bed soon. Have felt fine just a bit tired, but don't want to have to get up in the middle of the night to be sick, would rather have prevention rather than cure.
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Thanks Little Susie
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Thanks little Susie, I am beginning to think this now. I asked my mum if they said anything as she was with me and she said no. I will remember and ask when I go next time to make sure I know what my meds are for and when to take them. Guess it was late Friday afternoon and they wanted home.
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Had a good night's sleep, was only awake for an hour during the night, but I read my book and went back to sleep. Have been feeling fine, but taking it easy today. Actually feel better than I did before I went in for chemo, lol Mo
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Just home from my first session of FEC T and I have been given anti sickness and steroids at home, but I forgot to ask to I start them today, before I have my evening meal?
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: R I only got the 2 drugs I mentioned, I never got any ondensetron Mo
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: I got through to the oncology ward and the nurse said to take the steroids starting tomorrow for the next 3 days. And the anti sickness domperidone only when I feel sick. I thought I would get something as prevention rather than cure   Mo
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: I had problems getting in my needle and I think there were a lot of distractions and one of the nurses was doing a handover, so maybe one thought the other had done it. I will know for next time. Is it ok to take the anti sickness as a precaution rather than cure? Mo
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: I have been given dexamethasone 9 tablets do I take these for the next 3 days only. Domperidone for sickness do I take these only if I feel sick or do I take them everyday Phoned the helpline and a doctor phoned me back but she was of little help and told me to go back to the hospital to the oncology ward, but can't face going back to the hospital today. I have tried phoning the ward but no answer, so will keep trying. Thanks everyone Mo
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Thanks Ani If I could of got through to someone at the hospital sooner I might have as I was starving and it said to take at least 30 mins before food. I might just take before breakfast tomorrow Mo
Posts.Title: medication at home

Posts.Content: Well done Ladies, now time to celebrate Mo xxx P.S. glad to see I am bang on trend with my hairstyle
Posts.Title: I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Afternoon Ladies I got up to a beautiful sunny morning here in Aberdeen, but it didn't last long raining here now. Good luck for tomorrow Ali.  Feeling lazy today, I should be doing something as I have a busy week ahead of me. I have my look good feel better tomorrow, bloods on Wednesday, a friend visiting Thursday morning and Ct scan in afternoon and then.......drum roll........final chemo on Friday. Mo xx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Hi Pat It has dried up here now, but the sun hasn't come out. I will let you know, think it should be good, it will also give me a chance to see our Maggie's Centre, and what they have to offer. I can't wait to not have to go for chemo again. I want my life back again. I have been invited out for a Birthday meal in 3 weeks, I felt bad as the girl who's birthday it is asked me where I would like to go as she wants to make sure it is somewhere I would feel comfortable. I am also hoping I might get a drink as well. My step dad is doing well although my mum had a meeting with the hospital on Friday as she was worried he wasn't getting enough mental stimulation. They admitted that they didn't know he was a stroke patient and just thought he was there to recuperate. They have now put a plan in place. You need to tell your parents that you are unable to help them and for once you are going to be selfish and tell them they need to accept help as you are unable to help them and they are causing you distress, put yourself first. I am the opposite my mum offers help but I am too stubborn and independent. One thing I have learnt from this is to put myself first and to be a bit selfish and say no. Love and hugs to you too. Mo xxx Mo
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Pat Good luck for tomorrow, hopefully you will be up to spending time with your family this weekend. I had my second FEC on Friday and only started to feel myself yesterday, but they did say my blood cell count was low and I had an injection on Saturday to boost it. I also think the steroids make me feel worse.  Ali you have not had an easy time of it, glad you got some sleep as it does help. Stay warm as it is cold out there today. Take care Mo xx
Posts.Title: Morning Ladies

Posts.Content: If I struggle with sleep I drink chamomile tea and put some lavender oil on a tissue slipped inside my pillowcase. Also I asked my hairdresser what I should use on my scalp and she told me to keep using my argan oil shampoo, just a smaller amount and if my scalp feel a bit dry to use a small bit of my conditioner. And as a fun thing for days I don't feel like doing anything my mum bought me a colouring in book for adults and coloured pencils
Posts.Title: Chemo Survival Kit – Version 3 – 8 April 2015 - please read and contribute...

Posts.Content: Veritas, I have almond oil which I can rub in. I will also have a look at nu-nail. April, I never did the nail varnish, because I couldn't be bothered. I know, you are not meant to look glamour during and immediately after cancer treatment. I think they should build Cancer Spas, where when diagnosed you check into a luxury type spa, where they give you all your treatment but also provide you with the right amount of pampering to make you feel better. My hair is starting to come in as a bit of fuzz at the moment.
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: I lost a nail tonight, I went to itch an itch and my nail pinged off. I was wondering if I should  cover over the area where the nail was? Mo xx
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: Thanks Veritas Mine are not to tender (lost another one in bed last night). I am going to leave them open to the air to see how they go. I have seen people with nails like this after they have had acrylic nails. Was wondering if I should put something like cuticle oil or almond oil on them to help them grow? Mo
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: Thanks Susie, it is tender but not sore, I have a few that look like t h eye will go. Mind you it is only from halfway down the nail.  Mo. Xx
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone I am hoping to find something part time. Unfortunately due to a downturn in the oil industry at the moment there are not that many jobs around, so might take a bit of time to get anything.  Just have to hope my lottery numbers come up in the meantime, I can see myself sipping cocktails on a beach somewhere.....
Posts.Title: Yippee I did it.

Posts.Content: Stoatie I have just had my second one today, I found it ok, just felt a bit weary during the 3 weeks, but listen to your body. I tried to do too much one day and my body was quick in telling me as I took a funny turn. But I also hadn't eaten for a while as well, so now I make sure I eat regularly. I try to keep to a routine going to bed about the same time and getting up about the same time. The nurses are all lovely at the chemo ward and most people are friendly as we are all on the same mission to beat this thing. If you think you are not well or not sure of anything health wise in between don't be afraid to call the chemo line as they are helpful. I had a swollen gland and spent an afternoon in hospital, where they did every test possible before sending me home with antibiotics I am thinking of you. Mo xx
Posts.Title: Starting FEC T today

Posts.Content: I had my second one yesterday, and apart from not having much sleep last night, was having hot flushes, I am fine. I have to wait for the district nurse to come and give me an injection to boost my blood count, this is because of my hospital visit, but it will maybe make the next 3 weeks better. I expected all horrors of symptoms when I had my first, but apart from the fatigue I was ok. Just take it easy for the first 2 days and listen to your body. Mo. xx
Posts.Title: Starting FEC T today

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone I am hoping to find something part time. Unfortunately due to a downturn in the oil industry at the moment there are not that many jobs around, so might take a bit of time to get anything.  Just have to hope my lottery numbers come up in the meantime, I can see myself sipping cocktails on a beach somewhere.....
Posts.Title: Yippee I did it.

Posts.Content: Thanks Pat You haven't got long to go either. I noticed in another post that your mum was back in hospital. Sorry to hear that there is not much they can do for her. You will just have to enjoy the time you do have with her. I feel I have had an easy ride compared to you with your extra dramas.  Big hugs from me Mo xx
Posts.Title: Yippee I did it.

Posts.Content: Yippee I have reached the finish line. I had my finally radiotherapy session today. I have been discharged from oncology and do not have to return to the hospital until January. It feels like I have never been away from the hospital since December, but I have finally beat it and can officially become a NEDDY.  Only downside is I now need to look for a job, could have got used to being a lady of leisure.  Mo Xx
Posts.Title: Yippee I did it.

Posts.Content: Groggy Congratulations on finishing Radiotherapy, I think it will take a wee while for the tiredness to wear off a bit, so take it easy. A Neddy is when you have no evidence of disease and have been discharged, until your next check up. I don't have to go back till January. Mo xx
Posts.Title: Yippee I did it.

Posts.Content: Anastasia Sorry to hear that you haven't been feeling to great. Don't be afraid to rant on here, and I am sure if you told your family and friends how you really feel they will be fine with it. They are there as support as are we. I have also been on antibiotic, but only was in hospital for an afternoon while they did tests. I am also losing my hair, I am scared to brush my hair, even though I have prepared myself to lose my hair it is still hard.  I just always like to think that there is someone worse off than me out there and I will get through this and come out the other side ok. It is hard to always think like that especially if you are feeling unwell. Big hug from me Take care Mo xx
Posts.Title: Hospital stay

Posts.Content: Bev Come to mine as well, I have the same symptoms as Ali :) Mo xx
Posts.Title: Returned to work

Posts.Content: Well done Susie, now go and paint the town red. Mo xxx
Posts.Title: I did it too!

Posts.Content: Oh Pat that is not good, hope it doesn't stop your chemo. Enjoy a good meal and have a good night's rest. Hope the oncologist is fine with you tomorrow. Big hug from me. Mo Xx
Posts.Title: No place like home !

Posts.Content: Hi Pat I have been craving a full fry up with a runny fried egg. I also bought some brie today as well.  I have swollen ankles and feet, but I am going to try some dandelion tea to see if it will take the fluid off. Mo Xx
Posts.Title: Food question.?

Posts.Content: I bought mine from Amazon, but you could probably get it from Holland & Barrett or similar type shop. It was a Shiatsu practitioner who recommended it to me years ago. It actually tastes quite nice.
Posts.Title: Food question.?

Posts.Content: I will Ali.  I have used it before for fluid retention, and asked the nurse if I could use it now my Chemo is finished and she said why not. Dandelions are called wet the beds, so just hope I don't, lol Mo xx
Posts.Title: Food question.?
